title: Temperatures about to plunge with -4C temperatures and fog set for Halloween
text:
It’s about chillier and there could be snowy spells towards the end of next week (Picture: Met Office/Homes for Hounds

Misty skies and temperatures as low as -4C are expected on Halloween before by a wet and windy weekend.

But at least bright and blue skies across most of the UK today, particularly in Scotland, will help make up for the chilly start this morning.

Heavy downpours due across the country on Saturday and Sunday will bring to a close a spell of lovely sunshine which followed heavy flooding.

It should be a bit warmer at the start of next week but it could end with snow in some parts.

Giving this morning’s forecast, Met Office meteorologist Aidan McGivern said: ‘You may not be impressed by the cold and frosty start on Wednesday morning, but there will be plenty of sunshine around to compensate for the chill in the air.’

But southern Wales, central southern England and the south west are set for cloudier skies, a heavier breeze and a few outbreaks of rain around Devon, Dorset and Cornwall.

Temperatures have hit -5C and -6C in some parts of Scotland, with freezing fog patches around Glasgow, Renfrewshire.

Mr McGivern added: ‘They will take some time to lift during Wednesday morning, it may not be until lunchtime before the last of them clear off.’

From 2pm the region will creep back up into the high single figures while the mercury in England and Wales should be between 10C and 12C.

Outbreaks of rain are expected to edge their way northwards from South Wales to central southern England this afternoon.

Be sure to make sure your dogs are kept warm in frosty conditions (Picture: Homes for Hounds)

it’s been a crisp but sunny morning in Banbury, Oxfordshire (Picture: farmersamclarke)

Mr McGivern said weather-fronts sprawling eastwards overnight over cold ground will create ‘a lot of low clouds and mistiness.’

He added: ‘A murky start to the day on Halloween for Northern Ireland into Wales, the Midlands, southern counties of England as well.’

The Met Office has predicted temperatures of -4C for parts of north Scotland early in the morning, although it should heat up a bit when trick-or-treaters hit the streets.

Cloud and rain is due for the south and west of the country but the bright and sunny spell is expected to carry on in northern and eastern parts of the UK.

Downpours will hit southern England on Friday with light drizzles elsewhere in the country before heavy rain makes sweeps the country for the rest of the weekend.

Despite next week getting off to a snowy start, snow is expected to hit parts of the country from around November 10.

description: The Met Office predicts fog, mist and minus temperatures on Halloween and even snow in the UK at the end of next week.
